headline: 'Wayne Rooney slapped me - lots went through my head and I'm willing to fight'
body: WWE legend Wade Barrett has reignited his feud with Wayne Rooney, almost seven years after the England great slapped him in the face during an episode of Monday Night Raw
WWE commentator Wade Barrett has reignited his feud with football icon Wayne Rooney by challenging the football legend to a showdown in the wrestling ring.

The former five-time intercontinental champion is now a voice behind the WWE Smackdown's commentary desk. But he hasn't forgotten his infamous clash with the Manchester United hero during a Raw event in Manchester back in November 2015.

Barrett had a heated exchange with Rooney and stepped out of the ring to confront the then-United skipper at ringside, only to be floored by a stinging slap from the footballers, reports the Manchester Evening News.
Since that memorable night, Barrett, 43, has become one of wrestling's top commentators, while Rooney has taken the managerial reins at Championship club Plymouth Argyle.

Barrett has now divulged why he didn't hit back after Rooney's slap. "Wayne Rooney is lucky that he can afford better lawyers than I can," joked the WWE icon. "That's what I'll say. I think we're a physical mismatch. I'm twice the size of Wayne Rooney.

"I think if I had responded at that moment, there would have been plenty of lawsuits coming my way. He was still an active player for England. He was still an active player for Manchester United and I'm sure whoever the managers were at that point in time would not have been very happy with Wade Barrett placing his hands on the English golden boy Wayne Rooney.

"A number of factors played in my head very quickly when I decided to not retaliate, but the financial aspect was probably the biggest one!" Despite both having retired from their respective sports, Barrett is open to a one-off wrestling rematch, but only if he gets to face off against the England legend he confesses to being a "huge fan" of.

"I have told Wayne numerous times he has an open invite to come back to WWE," he declared. "We are both way past our peak. We are both way past our sell-by date. I'm a huge fan of Wayne Rooney. I was the biggest supporter of him as a player right up there with Paul Gascoigne in terms of my all-time favourite England players.
"Brilliant player. No one could ever forget how amazing he was in 2004 in the Euros when he was ripping teams apart as this young 18-year-old prodigy.

"So, I'm a big fan of the guy and I don't want this to be turned into some immense hatred I have for him. But in terms of stepping into our world, no pal, I'm throwing you back out. So, if he did ever want to lock horns as two old washed-up men in the WWE ring, bring it on, Wayne."

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Joshua Zirkzee makes final request as Red Devils must sell before next move
body: Manchester United's transfer work is in full flow as they prepare to sign Bologna and Netherlands striker Joshua Zirkzee and continue to work on strengthening other areas of the pitch
While Europe's attention turns to Euro 2024's finale this weekend when Spain and England face-off - clubs across the continent remain hard at work.

The end of the international tournament leaves little in the way of excuses for transfers to face any delay and, with the start of the 2024/25 season creeping up, deals must be done. Manchester United are no different and will hope that Netherlands' exit can accelerate their moves for the likes of Joshua Zirkzee and Matthijs de Ligt as they look to make their first signings of the summer.
Much improvement is required at Old Trafford following their worst ever Premier League finish last term. Erik ten Hag knows his side will have to improve after extending his contract.
Mirror Football takes a look at some of the biggest transfer stories surrounding the side.

The Bologna forward is set to be the first player added to United's squad this summer. The Red Devils have agreed terms for the Dutch international's arrival and now have a deal in place with Bologna to pay more than his release clause for a favourable payment plan.
A £35.7million fee will be paid over three years and Zirkzee is expected to sign a five-year contract. The 23-year-old former Bayern Munich forward has one demand for his arrival however.

It's reported that Zirkzee has asked to wear the No. 9 shirt vacated by Anthony Martial, whose contract expired at the end of last month. There could be competition for the shirt from Rasmus Hojlund who wears the number for Denmark.
Reports suggest that United can only look to sign PSG central midfielder Manuel Ugarte, if they are able to sell Casemiro first. The position has been deemed a priority for the club this summer.
Ugarte is said to be open to a move, despite no Champions League football on offer but United have seen a £38m bid turned down. They hope to pay no more than £45m.

The club started the window with a budget of £50m, so with moves for Zirkzee and De Ligt on the horizon, players must also depart. Al-Ittihad are said to be in talks for Casemiro with United keen to see the back of the Brazilian's £350,000-per-week wages.

Manchester United could have a difficult time persuading Bologna to part with another one of their stars after landing Zirkzee, but it may not prove impossible. A fee of £30m could prove enough to land Dan Ndoye

Manuel Minguzzi, editor at Tuttobologna, told the Manchester Evening News: "After Calafiori and Zirkzee, I don't think Bologna will give up a third starter. The management would not want to give him up and Ndoye is liked by new coach Vincenzo Italiano. In any case we are talking about £25-30m."
Ndoye's agent Fahd Adamson has admitted a move could be on the cards. "It is good that Manchester United are interested in Dan, and it is somehow logical as well," he said.

"United belong to INEOS, and Dan has already played for the other INEOS-owned clubs in Nice and Lausanne. He received countless WhatsApp messages from English clubs after the quarter-final against England. Let's see what emerges from them.
"We must discuss Dan's future with him and his family. We need to weigh things up well, to prevent him making the wrong career move."

headline: Jose Mourihno AI chat tool launched that can provide 'limitless' responses with fans
body: Former Chelsea and Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho has become the first celebrity to have his personality duped as an AI chat tool - and is capable of giving 'limitless' responses to fans
Jose Mourinho has become the first celebrity to be replicated as an AI chat tool, offering 'limitless' responses to fans.
A team of 100 people worked on creating the virtual 'Special One', filming hours of conversation about his career, football and personal life.
His voice, mannerisms and expressions were then processed through eight stages of software to produce an AI-powered clone of the former Chelsea boss.

The AI system can respond to users' questions and provide a limitless range of personalised responses. This is the first instance of AI technology being used to mimic the personality of a major talent in this way.
The amusing application was created by Snickers and can be accessed on smartphones via its 'Own Goal' page.
Fans are urged to share their funniest blunders to receive a video message from the gaffer, which can then be sent to their mates via WhatsApp.
Mourinho expressed his excitement at partnering with the chocolate brand to bring the technology to life.
The AI utilised unique 'chain of thought' architecture to make the responses as 'Jose-like' as possible. It was trained to not only look and sound like the real Jose, but think like him too.
Each response is tailored to the individual user, incorporating their names, their own goals and the AI-driven reactions of Jose.

Sergio Peniche, senior brand and content director at Mars Wrigley, chimed in: "Partnering with Jose Mourinho to create the AI version of himself brings a unique and entertaining twist to our 'Own Goal' campaign."

headline: Ex-Man Utd star Patrice Evra handed suspended prison sentence after 'abandoning family'
body: Former Manchester United defender Patrice Evra has been given a suspended prison sentence after allegedly failing to pay his ex-wife almost £1million in alimony
Former Manchester United and France football star Patrice Evra had been handed a suspended prison sentence for failing to pay close to £1million in alimony to his ex-wife.

Judges in the Paris suburb of Nanterre ruled that Evra, 43, had effectively ‘abandoned’ Sandra Evra, 42, and their children – a boy who is now 19 and a girl, aged 10 – between May 1, 2021 and September 28, 2023.

Lawyers for the footballer immediately appealed Tuesday’s verdict, which followed years of litigation. Evra, a multimillionaire following a hugely successful playing career, was alleged to owe his ex-wife a total of €969,000 (£814,000) in unpaid alimony.
“The sentence was 12 months in prison, suspended for two years,” a prosecuting source at the Hauts-de-Seine Correctional Court said on Friday. “Mr Evra’s legal team immediately appealed.”
Evra was also ordered to pay his ex-wife €4,000 (£3,360) for moral damages and €2,000 (£1,700) in legal costs.

Nathalie Dubois, Ms Evra’s barrister, said: “I hope that, thanks to this decision, Patrice Evra will finally understand that he is not above the law and that we cannot abandon our wife and children overnight. Even more so when they met at the age of 15 and she followed him all over the world to support his football career.”

Jérôme Boursican, for Mr Evra, insisted to Le Parisien that ‘the facts are disputed’ by his client. Mr Boursican said: “Mr. Patrice Evra appealed, knowing that he provided his wife with an apartment, a house with a swimming pool in the south of France and that he lent her almost two million euros for her daily life. A sum that she refuses to return, and this is the reason for this trial.”

The Evras married in 2007, but divorce proceedings were instigated around 2020, when the former Manchester United, Juventus, and Marseille defender was pictured kissing Danish model Margaux Alexandra.
Since then, Mr Evra and Margaux Alexandra have had two children of their own together, and are believed to be living in Dubai.
Evra was born in Dakar, the capital of Senegal, and then moved to Paris as a young child. In 2020, Sandra Evra spoke publicly about the affair that finally led to divorce after 25 years together.

She said their 'life long love story turned into a nightmare' and the man she once adored has turned into a 'bullying rat'. She said: “We had a wonderful family Christmas, an amazing holiday in the Maldives together and at New Year we kissed and cuddled together after spending a night as a family with our son and daughter.
“Two days later he left our home in Paris to go to work in London saying he would be back two weeks later. And I have never spoken to him since. He has tried to cut me out of my life.

“I saw photographs of him with another woman in London and then I got a call from my solicitor telling me that he wanted to divorce me. It was the worst day of my life. I was in shock, devastated, distraught.”
The couple were just 15-years-old when they met at school in Les Ulis – the Paris suburb that has produced numerous Premiership stars - and Sandra describes the moment as 'love at first sight'.
Sandra Evra decided to speak out after Mr Evra gave an interview in August 2020, saying that they only met at 'family moments' and were no longer 'sharing the same roof'.

headline: Jadon Sancho handed sensational Man Utd lifeline after showdown talks with Erik ten Hag
body: Jadon Sancho had a fallout with boss Erik ten Hag early last season, resulting in the Manchester United winger being banished from the first-team squad and loaned out to Borussia Dortmund
Jadon Sancho has returned to first-team training at Manchester United after agreeing to bury the hatchet with manager Erik ten Hag.

Sancho, 24, hasn't played for United since August 2023 following a much-publicised bust-up with the Red Devils boss. Ten Hag infamously called the £73million winger out during a press conference, criticising him for his displays in training ahead of United's 3-1 loss away to Arsenal back in September.

In a subsequent social media post, Sancho effectively accused his manager of lying and refused to apologise, a stance which he maintained throughout the season, even after being banished from the first-team dressing room. The England international was loaned out to former club Borussia Dortmund in the January transfer window, helping them reach the Champions League final with a string of encouraging performances.

Sancho has since been linked with a move away from Old Trafford but after a meeting with Ten Hag, he's now back in pre-season training. The Athletic also report that the ex-Manchester City academy star won't travel to Norway for United's friendly against Rosenberg but will be available thereafter.

It's explained that during a meeting at their Carrington training base this week, Ten Hag agreed to draw a line under Sancho's past issues, with the pair agreeing to move on. United have given no indication whether the decision means that the 24-year-old is no longer available for transfer.

The Red Devils were reportedly open to offers of around £40m, and although the club could still opt to get rid of Sancho before the summer window closes on August 30, his return implies that Ten Hag could look to use him in the new Premier League campaign, which for United begins at home to Fulham.

The 24-year-old has largely underwhelmed since his long-awaited move from Dortmund three years ago. During Ten Hag's first season, Sancho spent time training alone in order to re-focus himself mentally and physically following a difficult first 18 months back in Manchester, having left City in 2017.

Ten Hag stood firm throughout last season as Sancho refused to apologise. Recently-departed United coach Benni McCarthy offered an insight into the situation in May by telling South African news outlet 947: "I spoke to the manager and I said to him that you know the delicacy.
"I told him I think Jadon feels that if he apologises then he's going to be classed as someone who doesn't train hard, that doesn't work hard and that everything that was said against him was true.

"If you are from the streets, no one wants to apologise because then you're admitting you are not training well, you are lazy, everything you are accused of. Jadon wasn't going to have that. The manager just said that all he wants is an apology."

McCarthy added: "I spoke to Jadon as a coach, as a mentor, as a friend, and as someone who grew up on the streets and knows the code. But Jadon just wasn't seeing it. He said, 'I ain't apologising because if I do, I'm apologising for being lazy, always being late, not giving my best. That's what I'm apologising for'. And those were his reasons."
United will play Rosenberg, Rangers, Arsenal, Real Betis and Liverpool on their pre-season tour before facing rivals City in the Community Shield.

headline: Erik ten Hag explains why he wanted to add Ruud van Nistelrooy to Man Utd coaching staff
body: Erik ten Hag has brought Ruud van Nistelrooy in as an assistant coach, with the former striker returning to Manchester United having spent five years there as a player
Erik ten Hag has pinpointed Ruud van Nistelrooy's 'character and experience' as the primary reasons for appointing the Dutchman to his coaching staff.

Van Nistelrooy has arrived at Old Trafford as an assistant coach to Ten Hag amid an overhaul in the backroom team. Previous assistants Mitchell van der Grag and Benni McCarthy have departed, to be replaced by Van Nistelrooy and Rene Hake.

His new role as an assistant to Ten Hag marks a return to the Red Devils for Van Nistelrooy. The former striker previously spent five years at the club as a player, scoring 150 goals in 219 appearances between 2001 and 2006.

After retiring in 2012, he transitioned into coaching, rising up the ranks at PSV Eindhoven to take charge of their senior team in 2022. He left that role after only a year, though did win the KNVB Cup.

While he has not worked in football since leaving his job as PSV boss, Ten Hag believes that experience can help him at United. The United boss also insisted that Van Nistelrooy's previous spell at Old Trafford can be a huge boost.

“I think we did well. We achieved what we wanted to achieve, but we can’t sit still. We want to go forward and we are so pleased to get Ruud van Nistelrooy and Rene Hake in, to bring some new dynamic, to bring some new initiative and innovation,” Ten Hag said.

“First of all, his character has brought him so far and it’s an example for everyone here in the building. Of course, he will also bring some DNA of Manchester United in, but that character is such a strong driver and that is also what he shows as a coach.

“He has such a highly interesting profile, he’s so ambitious, he has the skills and he already has a lot of experience. He’s assisted the Dutch squad, in PSV he did the Under-19s as a manager, he did the Under-21s, Jong PSV, who were playing at the second level.
"Then he was manager of the first team. So much experience, but very young, very ambitious, very driven. With his skills and his intelligence, he will help all the players and the team.”

Van Nistelrooy has also been welcomed to his new role by sporting director Dan Ashworth. The executive is hoping that his stunning record as a player at United can translate into success for the current team.
“Together with Erik, we are working to strengthen all areas of our men’s first-team operations, and refreshing the coaching staff is an important part of that," Ashworth said.

“It’s a particular pleasure to welcome Ruud back to the club where he enjoyed so much success as a player, and I know that he and Rene will help reinforce the winning mentality and high standards we are aiming for.”

headline: How Man Utd could line up next season as Erik ten Hag targets THIRD Dutch star
body: Erik ten Hag is overhauling his Manchester United squad over the summer transfer window, with the Dutchman facing a number of selection headaches ahead of next season
Erik ten Hag is busy reshaping his squad for next season following a disappointing second campaign in charge.

Though he is now backed by the billions of Sir Jim Ratcliffe, United do face a difficult challenge with the Premier League's Profit and Sustainability rules. Even so, Ten Hag is hoping to bring about a Dutch revolution.

Joshua Zirkzee is close to arriving in a £36million deal from Bologna, while United are also pushing hard for Bayern Munich centre-back Matthijs de Ligt. According to The Sun, Ten Hag has also set his sights on PSG star Xavi Simons.

The midfielder scored a wondegoal to open the scoring against England in the semi-finals of Euro 2024 on Wednesday. Here, Mirror Football looks at how United could line up if they push ahead with a move for the 21-year-old.
This is the formation United deployed for much of last season, but a few changes will take place should the three Dutchmen arrive. Despite a rocky debut campaign, Andre Onana will continue in goal.

In defence, Diogo Dalot impressed at right-back and will keep that spot, while a fit-again Luke Shaw should be first-choice at left-back. If he does arrive, De Ligt would partner Lisandro Martinez in what would be one of the top-flight's best central defences.

In midfield, Simons would likely partner Kobbie Mainoo in the holding position. Captain Bruno Fernandes was one of the few bright spots last term and will likely continue to play as the central attacking midfielder.

On the wings meanwhile, Alejandro Garnacho has carved out a starting spot for himself. On the opposite wing, Zirkzee could well come in for Marcus Rashford, who endured a difficult campaign last term. And Rasmus Hojlund will look to build on a solid debut year up-front.
Line-up: Onana; Dalot, De Ligt, Martinez, Shaw; Mainoo, Simons; Zirkzee, Fernandes, Garnacho; Hojlund

A second option could be to use a 4-3-3 formation. That would see the same back five, with Onana in goal, Dalot at right-back and Shaw at left-back, with De Ligt partnering Martinez in central defence.

The midfield would be tweaked slightly, with Fernandes dropping back between Mainoo and Simons. The forward line could see the biggest change, with Marcus Rashford coming into the team in place of Zirkzee.
Width from the two wingers would be key, which would be the reason for Zirkzee dropping out. Garnacho would keep his place on the right wing, with Hojlund again going through the middle.
Line-up: Onana, Dalot, Martinez, De Ligt, Shaw; Mainoo, Fernandes, Simons; Rashford, Hojlund, Garnacho

If United are facing a team who are happy to sit in and defend in a low block, Ten Hag may need to go for a more attacking outlook. That could see United deploy a 3-5-2 formation to get as many attackers into the team as possible.

Defensive solidity would come from a back three of De Ligt, Martinez and Shaw. At wing-back, but acting more as traditional wingers could be Garnacho and Rashford, who would certainly add attacking zeal out wide.
A three-man midfield would again be made up of Mainoo, Simons and Fernandes. Crucially, this formation would also allow Zirkzee to partner Hojlund up-front as an out-and-out striker.
Line-up: Onana; De Ligt, Martinez, Shaw; Garnacho, Mainoo, Simons, Fernandes, Rashford; Hojlund, Zirkzee

headline: Erik ten Hag's summer business 'clever' after star spotted arriving at Man Utd training
body: Erik ten Hag extended his stay at Old Trafford until 2026 this summer and has brought in a familiar face at Manchester United to make sure he builds on their FA Cup final triumph two months ago
Erik ten Hag's call to bring back Manchester United icon Ruud van Nistelrooy as part of his coaching staff has been branded 'smart' by Louis Saha.
The striker, who scored 150 goals for United, has returned to the club to help his fellow Dutchman. And he arrived at Carrington on Monday to the jubilation of supporters.

Despite lifting the FA Cup, Ten Hag's men looked a shadow of the Red Devils of old last season, finishing eighth in the Premier League. One reason for this was limited goalscoring. United's 57 goals in the league equalled Crystal Palace's total and was only one better than 16th-placed Brentford.
Ex-United forward Saha believes that Van Nistelrooy's recruitment can improve United's goalscoring fortunes, citing the budding Rasmus Hojlund as someone who could benefit from the former marksman.
Dutchman Van Nistelrooy's first spell at Old Trafford was an enjoyable one. Five years and over 200 appearances under Sir Alex Ferguson saw the striker win an array of trophies.

Renowned for his striking instincts, the ex-Real Madrid man went down the coaching route upon retirement with former club PSV's academy and climbed the pecking order to become head coach for the 2022/23 season – in which his side scored 89 goals, topping the league in that category.
According to former strike partner Saha, Van Nistelrooy's unique blend of goalscoring prowess and his ability to impart this talent to others makes him the ideal mentor for the raw Hojlund.

Saha spoke to Gambling Zone, saying: “First of all, Ruud has become a complete manager and can create a style going forward but also across the field. He can definitely help this connection that has been missing between the forwards and midfield.
"When you have a striker like Rasmus Hojlund, it’s important to have a manager or a coach who knows exactly what he needs to get more opportunities.
“Having Ruud van Nistlerooy will really help because I believe that he knows exactly what type of movement Hojlund needs and what type of positional sense he needs.

“So I think it's a clever move for Erik ten Hag, bringing in a coach that will have a better understanding of what Hojlund needs to do as a striker. If he manages to distribute this information the right way to the attacking midfielders and how to create those one-on-one opportunities, we will see immediate improvement in results.

“Last year there was so much frustration in terms of the body language of the players, I would go as far to say it was horrific. I’m a quiet guy but I would be going mad if I saw that type of thing, it doesn’t make sense for strikers.”

Hojlund netted 16 times for United last campaign and has shown he perhaps has the potential to become a Van Nistelrooy-esque figure for Ten Hag’s forward line – and what better coach to help him reach that potential than the man himself?

Compatriot Ten Hag was pleased to welcome both Van Nistelrooy, as well as former Go Ahead Eagles coach Rene Hake to the club, saying in a statement: "I am delighted that Rene and Ruud have agreed to join our project, adding a wealth of experience, knowledge and new energy to the staff.
"Now is a good time to refresh the coaching team as we look to build on the achievements of the past two years and push to the next level."

headline: Gareth Southgate's England XI for Euro final: Alex Ferguson coach suggests shock change
body: Rene Meulensteen suggested Gareth Southgate make a mammoth change in England's Euro 2024 final against Spain in order to unsettle Luis de la Fuente's side
Former Manchester United coach Rene Meulensteen has sensationally proposed dropping Harry Kane for England's Euro 2024 final against Spain.

The Three Lions skipper has netted three times during the tournament, making him the competition's joint-top scorer alongside five other players. That is despite the fact he's been taken off in every knockout game, with speculation surrounding his fitness or lack thereof continually heating up throughout the tournament.

Kane entered the Euros having missed Bayern Munich last two games of the season following a back injury. Ollie Watkins' dramatic winner against the Netherlands has sparked a conversation over whether he should start ahead of the Tottenham man on Sunday.

Meulensteen - who served for six years as a coach under Sir Alex Ferguson - has suggested Gareth Southgate must drop his captain to the bench for the good of the team on Sunday (July 14). During an appearance on talkSPORT on Thursday (July 11), the Dutchman laid out his formula to unsettle Spain, which is centred on dropping the country's all-time goalscorer in the final.

"If you want to unsettle Spain, you need legs, energy and intensity," he said. "So if you could start with another striker, you keep Harry on the bench because if the game settles down going into the second half and still Kane can get a good 30 or 45 minutes, and maybe extra-time and penalties, you bring him in later in the game."

Watkins would be the obvious option to replace Kane after his goal against the Netherlands. But Ivan Toney has also come off the bench during the tournament and could provide Southgate with another option, should he choose to change it.

Meulensteen admitted he does not believe Southgate will make that call, but reiterated the danger Spain can cause if England do not press as a unit. "I would make sure that they got players there in the midfield that can back them [Spain] up and squeeze Spain. If you don't, because one player doesn't and Harry hasn't got the legs, they play around you".

Kane addressed his fitness concerns prior to their semi-final win over the Netherlands on Wednesday. He rebuffed the speculation over whether he is 100% fit, and went as far to state that he feels he's only getting sharper as the tournament goes.

"Maybe sometimes when I don't score I think the fitness one is an easy one just to throw in now – 'Why? Is there a reason? Is it his fitness? Is it not?' But like I said before the tournament, I felt like I had a good preparation going into it, I felt like I'm getting better and sharper as the games go along," Kane said.

headline: Gareth Bale's reaction when arriving at Man Utd training ground - and why transfer failed
body: The Welsh winger was all smiles when he rocked up to Carrington on international duty in 2019 - with a move from Real Madrid to Manchester United teased at the time

Gareth Bale walked into Manchester United's training complex for international training with Wales sporting a cheeky grin back in 2019 - as the rumour mill churned that the Red Devils were looking to edge him away from Real Madrid.

Ryan Giggs' side were borrowing United's Carrington complex to prepare for their games with Trinidad and Tobago, as well as Slovakia - the nation's facility in north Wales not quite ready at the time. And Bale's smile as he walked past a massive mural of Marcus Rashford added even more speculation as to whether the then 29-year-old was set for a move back to the UK.

As a youngster, the pacey and powerful left winger burst through the ranks at Southampton - before signing his first professional contract with the club in 2006. He would only remain in the southern city for one year before Spurs came knocking, snapping him up for £5million with the potential to rise to £10million - perhaps one of the biggest steals in Premier League history.

Bale would score 42 goals in 146 appearances at White Hart Lane for Spurs before a world-record money move to Real Madrid came to fruition in 2013 - the Galacticos paying £85.1million for his services. In his prime, the Welshman would win three league titles, five Champions League trophies, two UEFA Super Cups and a Copa del Ray - bagging 81 goals and 46 assists in 176 La Liga appearances.

He would return to Spurs for one last dance on loan in the 2020/21 season, before capping off his career at Los Angeles FC in 2023. One of, if not the greatest Welsh footballer of all time, Bale was a massive 'what if?' for United fans worldwide - who watched him develop and conquer with hopes that one day he would arrive at Old Trafford.

Speaking in 2013, Sir Alex Ferguson admitted that United were first in line to sign Bale from Southampton - only to reportedly be let down by officials at St Mary's. While Fergie never held a grudge against Bale, he was frustrated that the winger went to Spurs instead of the Reds.

He said at the time: "We were disappointed in Southampton at the time because we were first there, but they never came back to us. We were disappointed in that. Gareth was a left-back when we tried to sign him. It wasn't until Harry (Redknapp) went to Tottenham that he converted him into a wide-left player.

"He reminds me a bit of when we signed Lee Sharpe. Lee was a six-foot, gangly slim boy, but all of a sudden he was built like a light heavyweight American boxer. Bale is the same, the way he has developed physically in the last two years. He has matured very well."

While Ferguson would retire from Manchester United with 38 trophies to his name, the Red Devils didn't give up in their pursuit of bringing Bale to the North West. David Moyes said that he came close to making Bale his first official signing at United - but ultimately conceded that he would be unable to prevent a then-world record move to Madrid.

He told eirSport in 2019: "I wanted him to be my first signing at Manchester United. We came close, spoke to him, but he had his heart set on Real Madrid and we couldn't talk him out of it. It was a real disappointment because I saw him as a Manchester United-type player.

"He carries himself well, I think he's a terrific player. He can play wide, we can play as a striker now that he's developed that. I just think all round he's a terrific athlete and a brilliant footballer so I think that he would have fitted what we wanted but I couldn't talk him out of it."

When asked if Manchester United held talks with Bale about a move to Old Trafford, Moyes responded: "Yeah, we did. I think we even had a helicopter at the training ground waiting to go down and get him at one point. I think we had a bigger offer in and we had sorted things out but I think his heart was already on going to Real Madrid at the time."

It is reported that United made at least four moves for Bale before calling quits - once from Southampton and Tottenham, the other two from Madrid - but the Galacticos were unable to relinquish his services. While it is thought that Bale wanted away from Spain towards the latter stages of his career, his £350,000 wages were untenable for most clubs.

body: Manchester United are close to making Joshua Zirkzee their first signing of the summer transfer window, agreeing a £36million fee with Bologna after his nation were knocked out of Euro 2024
The ins and outs are in full flow at Manchester United as they prepare for the 2024-25 Premier League season.

A chunk of the Red Devils' squad were back in pre-season training on Monday, with manager Erik ten Hag buoyed by his recent contract extension. But there are some other changes in United's dugout, as assistant coaches Mitchell van der Gaag and Benni McCarthy have both departed the club.

The Dutch pair have been replaced by ex-United striker Ruud van Nistelrooy and Rene Hake, who recently left his post as manager of Eredivisie side Go Ahead Eagles. But what supporters really want is to see arrivals on the pitch - and they won't have to wait too long.
Here's a round-up of the latest transfer news from Old Trafford.

Joshua Zirkzee will have a medical at Manchester United on Friday, the Athletic report. The Red Devils have agreed a £36million fee with Italian side Bologna, despite 23-year-old Zirkzee having a slightly cheaper release clause.

That's so that United can spread the payments over three years, with the Netherlands international set to sign a contract which runs until 2029. Zirkzee, who came through the ranks at Bayern Munich, will mark the Red Devils' first signing of the INEOS era.

headline: 'I spoke to Arsenal and Man Utd about transfer - but ended up snubbing both of them'
body: Netherlands midfielder Ronald de Boer had the opportunity to play under Arsene Wenger at Arsenal and Sir Alex Ferguson at Manchester United, but the deals were never finalised
A move to Manchester United and Arsenal was on the cards for legendary Dutch midfielder Ronald de Boer, but neither materialised.
De Boer and his twin brother Frank spent the majority of their illustrious careers together, with spells at their boyhood club Ajax, Barcelona, and Rangers.
Impressing after the 1998 World Cup, where the Netherlands lost to Brazil in the semi-finals, De Boer had a host of clubs vying for his signature, including Arsene Wenger's Arsenal.
Made to stay put at Ajax that summer, a January move to Barcelona followed for the Dutchman, the subject of interest from Sir Alex Ferguson just a year later in 2000.
De Boer was initially close to landing in north London, but his club's refusal to sell him and his twin brother after the World Cup campaign they'd both just enjoyed left the move dead in the water.

He told FourFourTwo: “Yeah, I did speak with Arsene Wenger about joining Arsenal. That was before the 1998 World Cup. He called me to ask if we could meet so that he could explain his ideas in person.

“We met at the Okura Hotel in Amsterdam. He said I could be an important player for his Arsenal team and he demonstrated what my role could be. He was keen to sign me and I was happy to join: I felt like this kind of opportunity might not come again.

“Everything would be finalised after the World Cup. I remember speaking to David Dein on the phone, discussing my salary and the duration of my contract. Everything was sorted; it was only down to Ajax and Arsenal to agree a transfer fee.

“But me and Frank played very well at the World Cup and Ajax suddenly said they didn’t want any of us to leave – they wanted to retain the core of the team. We both felt misled, so decided that we wanted to leave Ajax immediately.”
Another English side, this one also donning red, approached De Boer again after he'd made his switch to La Liga - but the Dutchman was advised against the move by future United boss Louis van Gaal.
“I remember being in the Barcelona kit room, speaking to Alex Ferguson on the phone. He told me he was keen to sign me for United, and explained how he’d use me in midfield.

“But around the same time, Dick Advocaat approached me on behalf of Rangers. I remember being in the Dutch camp, talking about my future with Van Gaal, who had since become the head coach of the national team.
“I asked him what he thought. He said that at Rangers I’d always play, which would be better for me as a 30-year-old, and for my role in the Dutch team as well.

“I chose Rangers, also because of my knee, which wasn’t perfect. I wasn’t injured, but I thought I might not get through the United medical. At Rangers, I was able to sign for four years, which gave me some certainty. If Van Gaal had advised me to join United, however, I would have done that. I really valued his opinion.”

The midfielder spent four years at Rangers from 2000 until 2004 when he left to join Qatari club Al-Rayyan. He stayed in the country and acted as an Olympic advisor in 2010. De Boer never took the step into management as his brother, Frank, did with Inter, Crystal Palace and the Netherlands. The midfielder's career could've panned out very differently, however, were it not for Ajax's refusal and Van Gaal's advice.

headline: Rasmus Hojlund issues statement as Man Utd finalise transfer for striker Joshua Zirkzee
body: Manchester United have finalised a transfer deal to sign striker Joshua Zirkzee less than 12 months after splashing out £72million on Rasmus Hojlund, who had a mixed debut season
Manchester United forward Rasmus Hojlund is 'hungry' for the new season and the battle to be Erik ten Hag's starting striker.

Hojlund, 21, had a challenging first season at Old Trafford and finished on 16 goals in all competitions. The young Dane was relied on for almost the entirety of the campaign without a backup - but now there's set to be competition.

United have agreed a £36million deal to sign Dutch striker Joshua Zirkzee from Italian side Bologna. The 23-year-old scored 11 Serie A goals last term to fire Bologna into the Champions League places, although he's prepared to step down to the Europa League with United.

A 6ft 3in and used to being a lone striker like Hojlund, it's expected that only one of them will make it into Ten Hag's starting line-up once the new season gets going. Hojlund, though, is ready for the tussle, as he explained on Instagram.
Posting a picture of himself on holiday eating a huge tomahawk steak, the former Atalanta hotshot wrote as the caption: "This is how hungry I am for the season to start."

Hojlund's team-mates were loving his post in the replies, with midfielder Mason Mount writing: "Madman," alongside three laughing emojis. "Enjoy your holidays and stay calm," added defender Lisandro Martinez. Forward Alejandro Garnacho also posted: "It will be scary but not for us," in an ominous warning to their rivals.
Centre-back Harry Maguire spotted a glass of wine next to Hojlund and hilariously wrote: "I hope that's blackcurrant in that glass."
Your turn! Who'll start for Man Utd next season - Rasmus Hojlund or Joshua Zirkzee? Let us know in the comments section

Zirkzee is expected to provide competition for Hojlund after he completes his medical at the Red Devils' Carrington training ground on Friday. United have agreed to pay slightly more than the Dutchman's £34m release clause because that would've needed to be paid immediately as a lump sum.

The higher fee allows the Red Devils to pay for Zirkzee over a three-year period. The ex-Bayern Munich prospect - who had loan spells with Parma and Anderlecht before signing for Bologna in 2022 - made his debut for the Netherlands last weekend, coming on as a second-half substitute during their quarter-final victory over Turkey.

Zirkzee came on in injury time against England on Wednesday but he couldn't help Ronald Koeman's side respond to Ollie Watkins' 91st-minute winner. Zirkzee's debut for United could come as soon as Monday, as the Red Devils face Norweigan side Rosenborg in Trondheim to begin their globe-trotting pre-season tour.

headline: Erik ten Hag confirms reason No.2 Mitchell van der Gaag has immediately left Man Utd
body: Mitchell van der Gaag followed Erik ten Hag from Ajax to Manchester United in 2022 but the assistant coach has now departed Old Trafford to pursue his career ambitions
Erik ten Hag has confirmed that right-hand man Mitchell van der Gaag has left Manchester United in order to become a first-team manager himself.

Van der Gaag was Ten Hag's trusted assistant at Ajax and the pair both made the move to Old Trafford in May 2022. The 52-year-old coach helped United win a trophy in each of his two seasons but won't continue in his role for the upcoming campaign.

That's allowed Ten Hag's good friend and the former manager of Eredivisie side Go Ahead Eagles, Rene Hake, to join the Dutchman's coaching setup alongside compatriot Ruud van Nistelrooy, who's been brought in to replace outgoing forward coach Benni McCarthy. In a statement announcing the pair's arrivals, Ten Hag paid tribute to Van der Gaag and McCarthy.

"Mitchell has decided that now is the right time for him to pursue his own ambitions in a number one position," the United boss, who was recently handed a one-year contract extension, remarked. "I want to pay tribute to his fantastic service over the past two years. "Also to Benni for his important contributions. We send them our thanks and best wishes for the future."

Steve McClaren and Darren Fletcher will remain part of Ten Hag's backroom staff, now joined by Hake and Van Nistelrooy. Hake helped Go Ahead Eagles to their best league finish in 15 years last season and they'll even take part in the Conference League play-offs later this summer.

Van Nistelrooy, meanwhile, spent five years at Old Trafford, scoring 150 goals in only 219 appearances and winning the Premier League title in 2003 under Sir Alex Ferguson. The ex-striker managed PSV Eindhoven in the 2022-23, winning the Dutch cup, and was in talks to take the Burnley job before United's successful pursuit.

"I am delighted that Rene and Ruud have agreed to join our project, adding a wealth of experience, knowledge and new energy to the staff," Ten Hag said of their appointments. "Now is a good time to refresh the coaching team as we look to build on the achievements of the past two years and push to the next level."

The Red Devils' newly-appointed sporting director, Dan Ashworth, also said: "Together with Erik, we are working to strengthen all areas of our men's first-team operations, and refreshing the coaching staff is an important part of that.

"It's a particular pleasure to welcome Ruud back to the club where he enjoyed so much success as a player, and I know that he and Rene will help reinforce the winning mentality and high standards we are aiming for."

headline: Why Man Utd have decided to pay more for Joshua Zirkzee than his release clause
body: Manchester United are set to sign striker Joshua Zirkzee from Serie A side Bologna in a deal that will see them pay more than the Dutchman's £34million release clause
Manchester United are closing in on Joshua Zirkzee - but are set to pay more than the strikers £34million release clause.

Zirkzee is set to fly to the UK to undergo on a medical on Friday after the Netherlands were knocked out of Euro 2024. The 24-year-old came on as a substitute as his side were beaten 2-1 by England in their semi-final clash on Wednesday.
United have agreed a deal with Bologna to pay €42.5m (£35.7m) instead of triggering Zirkzee's £34m release clause. That is because they would have had to have paid the release clause in full.

However, United will now be able to pay the fee in instalments across a three-year period. Zirkzee is also set to sign a five-year contract, with United having an option to extend it for a further year.

Following the Netherland's Euros exit, Zirkzee wrote on social media: "A big let down last night. It was a dream come true to be part of this team (yet still) and I am proud and grateful to wear this shirt. Orange fans, thank you for your support."

The Red Devils are also closing in on Matthijs De Ligt, while Lazio prepare to hijack Mason Greenwood's move to Marseille. United are ready to pay £43million to Bayern Munich for Dutch centre-half De Ligt, who featured under manager Erik ten Hag at Ajax, but who did not play at minute at Euro 2024.

Lazio were the early favourites to land Greenwood before Marseille offered £27million for the striker, who has no future at Old Trafford. But Marseille mayor Benoit Payan is leading opposition to the move because Greenwood was arrested in 2022 over allegations of attempted rape, assault and coercive behaviour, although all charges were subsequently dropped by the Crown Prosecution Service.

"I do not want my club to be covered in shame," Payan told RMC. "It is not acceptable." A number of Marseille fans also protested against the club's move for Greenwood, with the #GreenwoodNotWelcome hashtag used on social media.

New Marseille boss and former Brighton manager Roberto De Zerbi has tried to defend Greenwood and United need to sell him to help pay for Zirkzee and De Ligt. "Greenwood isn't recruited yet, so there isn't much to say," said De Zerbi when asked about the move.

"He's a champion, an international level player. I don't know what happened, I'm not concentrating on private lives. When a player signs for the club, I consider him my child. Even if I can pull his ear in private, I will defend him publicly. My players are like my sons."

headline: Top British athlete to make racing bow raising money for victims of domestic abuse
body: Heptathlete Ellen Barber, whose grandfather Paul Barber owned top jumpers See More Business and Denman, is to ride in the Magnolia Cup charity race
A British athlete with an illustrious racing pedigree has been picked to ride in a prestigious charity race.

Heptathlete Ellen Barber has won numerous national championships and was ranked No.1 in her specialism in Britain in 2020. The 26-year-old is the granddaughter of the late Paul Barber, who was landlord and mentor to 14-time champion jumps trainer Paul Nicholls.

Barber, who died in June last year aged 80, also owned See More Business, who won the Cheltenham Gold Cup in 1999 and also involved in the great Denman, the 2008 Gold Cup winner, as well as horses with former Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson such as Clan Des Obeaux.

Ellen Barber has now revealed she has been training since September last year to ride in the Markel Magnolia Cup, a charity race for part-time riders held every year during the Glorious Goodwood meeting.
She will be raising money for  MySistersHouse  which helps provide support and refuge for victims of domestic abuse.
Barber announced her selection for the race, which features 12 female riders, in a post on her X account, revealing she had been riding out for trainer Karl Burke in Middleham.

Explaining her motivation for taking part on the JustGiving page she wrote: “Firstly one of the biggest reasons is that I wanted to ride in Magnolia Cup as a tribute to my Grandfather Paul Barber who sadly passed last year.

“He held such a legacy in horse racing and I just know he would have absolutely loved seeing me on a racehorse.. Racing!! Secondly, I want to empower and encourage women to show them they can work/study alongside pursuing their dreams, knowing that anything is possible.
“Lastly… I am super competitive and just love an adrenaline surge and thought this was just a fantastic opportunity I couldn’t refuse!!”
She continued: “Training has been amazing so far and it’s fun to juggle around my actual athletics training!

“I am managing to ride out for Karl Burke on my ‘rest days’ which is just amazing. His horses are incredibly fast and it’s an incredible part of the country to ride out in. I’m loving every minute of it.

“I am so thrilled that we are riding for the charity My Sisters’ House. They work and care for women to help and support improve their welfare and wellbeing, reduce their risk of domestic abuse and support their recovery, and help women reach your goals for employment, education or training. Just amazing.”

headline: Kobbie Mainoo shows his class with one action before Euro 2024 semi-final
body: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo reached out to one of his former team-mates on the same day as England's semi-final with the Netherlands at Euro 2024
England star Kobbie Mainoo showed a touch of class ahead of facing the Netherlands in their Euro 2024 semi-final.

The Manchester United midfielder partnered Declan Rice and produced an impressive display against the Dutch side. Mainoo, 19, has enjoyed a remarkable rise since making his first league start for United in November, and reaching a Euros final is the latest milestone in his incredible journey.

Mainoo, who scored in the FA Cup final, has consistently been unfazed by the pressure of the occasion. The teenager proved as much by finding time to congratulate one of his ex-team-mates on the same day that he lined up in a semi-final for the Three Lions.

Former United striker Charlie McNeill announced that he had signed for Sheffield Wednesday on a three-year deal after leaving Old Trafford. Mainoo was one of many Red Devils youngsters to wish him well on social media, commenting with a heart emoji hours before kick-off in Dortmund.

McNeill was released by United this summer after coming to the end of his contract. The 20-year-old was once snapped up from local rivals Manchester City - scoring 24 goals in 21 U18 games during his debut season - and made his sole first-team appearance aged 18, coming on against Real Sociedad in the Europa League.

The forward previously had short loan spells at Newport County and Stevenage but will hope to showcase his quality at the Owls. On Instagram, McNeill wrote: “Delighted to join this massive club for the next three years! Can’t wait to get started and see all the fans at Hillsborough.”

Meanwhile, Mainoo’s focus will be on ending his breakthrough season with another flourish as this England side aim to make history. The young midfielder started the tournament on the bench but has arguably become an undroppable player for England boss Gareth Southgate in a short space of time.

Asked to sum up what he has achieved so far, Mainoo said: "It's been unbelievable... I think I've worked hard this season. I never would have thought I'd be [at the Euros], but I always backed myself.

"Whenever I get a chance to play I give it 100% every time. That's what my parents have always said to me, when you get your chance you have to grab it with both hands. [Playing for England] is feeling better and better every time, so I think it'll only get better from here."

headline: Mason Greenwood transfer: Marseille stance on ditching move after brutal statement
body: Marseille have agreed a deal to sign Man Utd forward Mason Greenwood on a permanent transfer but the move still has several hurdles to overcome before it is made official and Italian side Lazio also remain keen on the 22-year-old
Marseille have not been deterred in their quest to sign Manchester United forward Mason Greenwood despite fierce criticism from the city's mayor, Benoit Payan.

Greenwood has not featured for United since January 2022 when he was suspended by the club following his arrest for attempted rape, engaging in controlling and coercive behaviour, and assault occasioning actual bodily harm, Greenwood saw the case against him discontinued when the Crown Prosecution Service withdrew all charges, following the withdrawal of co-operation from key witnesses.

Speaking to RMC Sport earlier this week, Payan made it clear that he strongly opposes the transfer after the Ligue 1 giants saw a bid accepted by United. Payan said: "I do not want my club to be covered in shame. It is not acceptable."
Marseille fans have also been attempting to get the hashtag #GreenwoodNotWelcome trending on social media platform X.

The deal that could see the former Getafe loanee move to the south of France is worth a reported £26.7million, £23.3m as a fixed fee, £3.4m in add-ons plus a whopping 50 per cent sell-on clause. However, despite an agreement between the clubs, Greenwood is yet to agree personal terms with Marseille and sources suggest the player is hesitant to complete the move following Payan's statement.
Despite suffering abuse from opposition fans in La Liga, Greenwood was welcomed wholeheartedly at Getafe, who had shown interest in another loan but United favoured a permanent sale this summer.
Lazio continue to circle and would be prepared to include a substantial release clause in any deal to land the winger, though they are yet to have a bid accepted by United.
The 22-year-old met with Old Trafford chiefs on Monday at Carrington in which he was told he was free to find a new club and that he would not be returning to pre-season training with the Red Devils.

Former Brighton boss Roberto De Zerbi, who was recently appointed Marseille head coach, said on a potential transfer earlier this week: "I don't know his [Greenwood's] past. I don't know exactly what happened. Honestly, I don't like interfering in players' lives. I have nothing to say about this.
"The only thing I can tell you - it doesn't matter who the player is. Once he signs for the club where I work, so here, they become like my children. I protect them against all the odds."
Meanwhile, Marseille have also shown an initial interest in Arsenal striker Eddie Nketiah.

headline: Man Utd star was naked and 'dripping wet' in awkward dressing room encounter with Drake
body: Drake is a huge Manchester United fan and was introduced to the club's stars by Rio Ferdinand - but one player was left in a very awkward situation when meeting the rapper
Manchester United icon Rio Ferdinand has shared a hilarious locker room tale about the time he introduced music megastar Drake to one of his teammates, who happened to be fully naked and soaking wet.

The Canadian rapper has a soft spot for the Premier League giants and popped over to Old Trafford during the golden era of Sir Alex Ferguson's tenure. During that time, Cristiano Ronaldo and Wayne Rooney were propelling the Red Devils to numerous league triumphs and the coveted Champions League trophy in 2008.

During a visit, Drake wanted to catch up with Ferdinand, but little did he know that he'd also get an unexpected introduction to Ferdinand's teammate, Owen Hargreaves. The encounter took an awkward turn as Hargreaves was completely taken aback by the sudden appearance of Drake and his crew.

Revealing all on his FIVE podcast, with Hargreaves right beside him, Ferdinand recounted the cringeworthy moment: "[I told Hargreaves] 'Come out, I need you to meet this guy, man'. He [Hargreaves] came out all wet dripping, hair all over. Drake is standing there [and] my guy [Hargreaves] is standing there with the fruit and veg out, as you do."

Confirming the incident, Hargreaves added his side of the story, admitting he was only clad in a towel slung over his shoulder, which left Drake's posse quite shocked. The ex-midfielder said: "So he's [Ferdinand] called me. He said, 'Oh, come out. I want you to meet somebody'. So I can't see, all I can do is hear him.

"So I come out, Rio's there, I look around the corner, I see this guy and I think, 'Is that Drake? ' "He's there with his 10 homies or whatever, and there's me. All I got is sliders on and my towel over my arm.
"And he [Ferdinand] says to me, 'It's Drake'. And I say, 'I know who it is'. And his homies were looking at me like, 'What's going on here?

Hargreaves made the move to United from Bundesliga heavyweights Bayern Munich in 2007, having previously played youth football at Canadian underdogs Calgary Foothills. He was born to British parents who had moved to Canada before his birth.
However, the career of the 42-cap England international has been largely overshadowed by severe injury issues which ultimately ended his career at just 31.

The midfielder clinched the Bundesliga four times, DFB-Pokal three times, and the Champions League with Bayern Munich before adding to his trophy haul at Old Trafford. Hargreaves played a crucial role in United's 2007/08 Premier League and Champions League double-winning squad, but injuries limited him to only five more appearances over the next three seasons.

headline: Man Utd outcast breathes sigh of relief after 'finally' signing for new club
body: Charlie McNeill left Manchester United when his contract expired in June and the striker has now joined Championship side Sheffield Wednesday on a free transfer
Charlie McNeill has finally got his move to Sheffield Wednesday after trying for "over a year" to join them from Manchester United.

McNeill, 20, was once a hot prospect at Old Trafford, starring in United's FA Youth Cup win two years ago alongside the likes of Alejandro Garnacho and Kobbie Mainoo. The former Manchester City academy star was loaned to League One side Stevenage at the beginning of last season but United recalled him in January after he found minutes hard to come by.

Having been given his first-team debut by Erik ten Hag in September 2022, McNeill saw his contract expire last month and has now moved on to pastures new in South Yorkshire. It's a switch which the 20-year-old has seemingly been trying to engineer for more than 12 months after two work experience loans.

"I am absolutely buzzing to finally get it over the line," McNeill told Wednesday's media channels. "I have been trying to come here for maybe over a year, so just to finally get it done, and knowing the manager really wanted me, is special to me."
"I came here on work experience two years ago under the previous manager [Darren Moore] and really liked it. I have known a few of the lads since then which was good."
During his second spell with the Owls, the youngster got to experience life under German head coach Danny Rohl, whose team were fighting to maintain their Championship status.
"In April last season, I came here under Danny and really liked it again," McNeill explained. "His style of play really made me want to join the club."

McNeill was poached by United in 2020 after scoring goals for fun during his time in City's academy, allowing him to command a £750,000 fee aged 17.
Having also been on loan at Newport County of League Two in the 2022/23 season, he now wants to establish himself in the EFL before making a return to the Premier League.

"I had a great time in academy football and achieved a lot, but this is now where it really starts in proper men's football," McNeill added. "I have had a taste of it at Newport and Stevenage before with my loans and everything, but this is where it really starts now."

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Leny Yoro sets record straight as £35m man sends farewell message
body: Manchester United have welcomed back some members of their first-team squad for pre-season training as Erik ten Hag prepares for the upcoming Premier League campaign
It's been slower going for Manchester United compared to last summer's transfer market, but we're beginning to see some movement.

This time last year, United had already sealed their first big-money deal of the summer with Mason Mount joining from Chelsea. There have been no senior additions this time out, at least at the time of writing, though some high-profile exits have been completed.

Raphael Varane and Anthony Martial are the biggest names to move on, with Brandon Williams and Omari Forson also exiting. Donny van de Beek will be the next to go, with United taking a big financial hit on the Dutch international.
As for incomings, the conversation around Leny Yoro is not dying down in a hurry. Here are Mirror Football's latest lines from around Old Trafford.

Leny Yoro has called out a fake social media account posing as him and suggesting he doesn't want to join Manchester United. The Premier League club face a battle to land the Lille centre-back, with Real Madrid also keen.

The comments prompted many fans on social media to urge the teenager to move to Old Trafford. While no decision has been made on his future, Lille president Olivier Letang has already indicated a summer exit is likely.

Yoro was a regular for Lille last season as Les Dogues finished fourth, sending them into the Champions League qualifying rounds. However, with a year left on his contract, he is expected to move on for a decent sum.

Manchester United have held discussions over a potential move for Ivan Toney or Dominic Calvert-Lewin this summer, according to The Athletic. Toney is currently away with England at Euro 2024, while Everton's Calvert-Lewin is back on Merseyside after Newcastle United pulled out of a potential move.

The Premier League pair aren't the only attacking options, though. Joshua Zirkzee remains high on United's list, and could well end up moving to Old Trafford if issues over a transfer fee from Bologna are resolved.

United already have Rasmus Hojlund leading the line, but the lack of backup for the Dane was a concern last season. And, with Martial leaving at the expiry of his contract, attacking depth is even lower than at this point last year.

Donny van de Beek has penned an emotional farewell to Manchester United ahead of his move to Girona. The £35m Dutchman is set to move for a cut-price £500,000 fee, though United are understood to have included add-ons and a sell-on clause.

"Dear Manchester United family. Today is a memorable day as my adventure at the club comes to an end," the former Ajax star wrote on Instagram. "I want to thank you all for your support throughout the years. From the moment we arrived at Manchester United, we felt extremely welcome and we are grateful for that.

"Thank you to everyone at the club for making us feel at home. A special thanks to all the fans that made these years unforgettable. Besides the football, the birth of our two children here ensures that Manchester will always have a special place in our hearts. Good luck to everybody, we’ll meet again.

headline: Man Utd offer Jarrad Branthwaite eye-watering salary but huge problem remains
body: Manchester United continue to chase a deal for Everton star Jarrad Branthwaite as Erik ten Hag attempts to sign a new defender amid further links with Leny Yoro and Matthijs de Ligt
Manchester United have promised to QUADRUPLE Jarrad Branthwaite’s salary should he move to Old Trafford.
The Red Devils have identified the Everton centre-back as one of their prime targets this summer. And they are so keen on signing him that they are willing to offer him a huge wage increase.
They will offer him a £165k-per-week wage packet at Old Trafford - a huge increase on the £35k he currently banks at Goodison Park, as first reported by The Times,.
It would also see United get close to a new rule introduced by Erik ten Hag. The club have enforced a so-called ‘Ronaldo rule’ that would see players’ salaries limited to £200k per week.

While Man United have already offered terms to Branthwaite, there is one problem remaining - they have not agreed a few with Everton yet. The Red Devils have seen two bids rejected for the defender, the latest worth £45m plus £5m in add-ons.
The Toffees want to receive around £70m for the centre-back. They have demanded that amount having compared the deal that took Wesley Fofana to Chelsea in 2022.

“We don’t want to sell any good players,” Everton boss Sean Dyche said earlier this year. “It’s as simple as that and he’s [Branthwaite] proven to be a very good player. We’re not in the business of trying to sell players.

“You only sell players if you have to sell players or there’s a problem. There’s no problem, therefore I’m just hoping we don’t need to sell players. At the minute, we certainly don’t so we will see.”
While the Red Devils consider a third bid, they have other defensive options in mind. They have already agreed personal terms with Bayern Munich and Netherlands centre-back Matthijs de Ligt.
Man United have also had a bid accepted for Lille starlet Leny Yoro. They have offered £42million for the Frenchman - which is reportedly ‘superior’ to an offer tabled by Real Madrid.
But Yoro has dealt a blow to the Red Devils by revealing that he is holding out for a move to the Santiago Bernabeu. He has already broken his silence on speculation around his services.
An account personating the defender wrote: “I don’t want you @ManUtd. Leave me alone,” to which he replied: “Fake account. You guys are psycho. Signal [report] this account.”
Man United aren’t just keen on signing a new defender. They are also closing in on a deal for Bologna defender Joshua Zirkzee, while PSG ’s Manuel Ugarte is a target for midfield.

headline: Premier League star Man Utd snubbed in transfer told he can emulate Diego Maradona
body: Premier League shot-stopper Emiliano Martinez has established himself as one of the world's best, but could have been playing under Erik ten Hag had the club not pulled the plug on a deal
The agent of former Manchester United transfer target Emiliano Martinez reckons the goalkeeper can emulate compatriot Diego Maradona and bring trophies to Aston Villa.

On the back of Bernd Leno's injury for Arsenal, Argentinian deputy Martinez stepped in and made a name for himself, winning the FA Cup in 2020. He then joined Aston Villa that summer and quickly became one of the Premier League's best shot-stoppers.

When David de Gea left United in 2023, a new man between the sticks was needed. Martinez was at the top of that list, but United turned instead to Andre Onana, someone Erik Ten Hag was familiar with at Ajax.

Now, the Argentinian's agent has spoken about his client's frustration at the deal's collapse and how Martinez can emulate Maradona in bringing success to the Villans, who are in this year's Champions League.

While Onana's time at United has been dotted with pivotal errors, Martinez has come on leaps and bounds. A World Cup winner with Argentina and progressing well in this year's Copa America, there's no real debate over who is the best keeper.
Martinez's agent, Gustavo Goni, recalled the prospective United deal, telling ESPN: "Emiliano had the chance last year to go to Manchester United. We were very close.

"The manager at the time decided in favour of Andre Onana because he already knew him from Ajax. But everyone in Manchester said that the ideal goalkeeper to win was Emiliano Martinez. The sporting director, the scouts, and everyone we spoke to."

Goni also believes that his client could go on to do great things with the Villans, stating, "He has the chance to become for Aston Villa what Diego Maradona was for Napoli. Maradona was great at Napoli, and being there did not stop him from being the best in the world.

"I always tell Dibu that he has the chance to repeat at Aston Villa what Maradona did at Napoli. Today he is in one of the best projects, they have one of the best sporting directors in the world, they have one of the most prestigious coaches in the world, and they have qualified for the Champions League when nobody thought it was possible.

"They will surely compete in the Champions League, and with a goalkeeper like Emiliano, who can easily surprise you, perhaps they will end up competing on a big scale. Perhaps he can put Aston Villa at the level of the big European clubs."
Though a move this summer isn't completely ruled out, Martinez looks likely to stay at Villa Park and could play a Maradona-like role in helping his club taste success in a European competition.

Sancho had been banished from first-team training since last September due to his fall-out with the manager, which had prompted his subsequent January loan to Dortmund, with whom he reached the Champions League final in May.

The Manchester Evening News understands that Ten Hag and Sancho held a positive meeting this week and agreed to put their disagreement behind them and move on. The 24-year-old has resumed full training as a result.
